Can be used to hold up to 10 bees. Use while sneaking to release them.
tooltip.resourcefulbees.jei.click_bee_in: Click or Right-Click for more info!
gui.resourcefulbees.jei.category.mutatio: Bee block mutation requires there to be a valid hive for the bee to go into & the bee to have nectar.
gui.resourcefulbees.jei.category.breed_c: Chance that this will succeed in creating a new bee.
gui.resourcefulbees.jei.category.mutatio: Chance that this will succeed in mutating.
item.resourcefulbees.information.beepedi: Use on a bee to see it's information
gui.resourcefulbees.beepedia.home.issues: Found a bug/issue? submit it here.

This aura will grant all players within the bee's aura range §5%s§7.
This aura will grant all players within the bee's aura range §2%d§7 health.
This aura will deal §4%d§7 damage to all players within the bee's aura range.
This aura will grant §a%d§7 experience to all players within the bee's aura range.
This aura will remove §c%d§7 experience to all players within the bee's aura range.
your aura is missing it's effect type.
gui.resourcefulbees.tab.traits.aura.not_: This aura is §4NOT§7 disabled by the calming effect, be careful around bees with this trait.
This aura is not disabled by the calming effect.
gui.resourcefulbees.tab.traits.aura.calm: This aura is disabled by the calming effect.

block.resourcefulbees.apiary.tooltip.tag: Multiblock can be built using any block from the valid_apiary tag.
block.resourcefulbees.apiary.tooltip.off: Offset determines the location of the Apiary Block based on its facing direction.
block.resourcefulbees.apiary.tooltip.loc: Bees must be locked and selected to export.
block.resourcefulbees.centrifuge.tooltip: Converts Honeycombs into resources using RF.
item.resourcefulbees.honey_dipper.hive_s: Hive position for [%s] has been set to %s
item.resourcefulbees.honey_dipper.flower: Flower position for [%s] has been set to %s
item.resourcefulbees.smoker.tooltip: Right click the hive to smoke it.
item.resourcefulbees.smoker.tooltip.1: Bees won't get angry for 30s when shearing honeycombs.
trait.resourcefulbees.special.teleport: During the day the bee can randomly teleport to an empty position within 4 blocks. This ability is stopped by the Ender Beecon and Bee Hives.
trait.resourcefulbees.special.flammable: This effect will randomly light the bee on fire.
trait.resourcefulbees.special.angry: Bees with this effect will become aggressive and cause bees around to join them. They can and will attack you, Calming effects will stop them from being angry.
trait.resourcefulbees.special.slimy: Slimy bees will make squishy sounds and spurt out slime particles at random.
trait.resourcefulbees.special.spider: Allows bees to fly through spiderwebs without issues.
block.resourcefulbees.mech_centrifuge.to: Hold SHIFT & right-click block to process honeycombs.
block.resourcefulbees.beecon.tooltip.inf: [Prevents bees from teleporting in effect range]
item.resourcefulbees.scraper.tooltip: Right-click on Tiered Beehives to collect honeycombs.
item.resourcefulbees.scraper.tooltip.1: Must collect ALL honeycombs for bees to generate new ones!
block.resourcefulbees.apiary_breeder.too: An OPTIONAL breeder that can be added as part of the Apiary Multiblock
Can be upgraded with additional breeders or time modifiers.
item.resourcefulbees.apiary_breed_time_u: Reduces max breed time by 300 ticks.
item.resourcefulbees.apiary_breeder_upgr: Adds additional breeders to the Apiary Breeder
block.resourcefulbees.centrifuge.tooltip: Centrifuge multiblock size is 3x4x3, consisting of one controller and the rest casings.
The controller must be the one block up from the bottom in the center of any face.
Any block in the multiblock will import/export items and energy
item.resourcefulbees.hive_upgrade.toolti: Use on a previous tier nest to upgrade it
book.resourcefulbees.name: Fifty Shades of Bees
book.resourcefulbees.landing_text: Welcome Resourceful Beekeeper! This guide is much less filled with bee erotica than it is information about beekeeping. We hope that it serves you well in understanding the basics.$(br)$(o)$(#ff0000)Please keep in mind that MOST, if not ALL, bees are added by pack developers!$()
book.resourcefulbees.apiary_category.des: The best of the best beekeepers maintain apiaries for the varieties of bees they own. Here, we will cover how to build one, why you want one, what it can do to expand your capabilities as a beekeeper.
book.resourcefulbees.apiary_category.api: There are $(or)four tiers$() to the apiary.$(br2)Each tier $(or)increases$() the amount of $(or)combs$() generated per bee and $(or)decreases$() the amount of $(or)time$() the bee spends in the Apiary.$(br2)An Apiary can only be occupied by nine $(or)unique$() bees.

This means that no more than one of each bee type can be inside the Apiary block at a time.$(br2)As many bees as you'd like can be inside the structure however.$(br2)Some players have found optimal ways to keep bees regularly going in and out so they are always generating combs.

To make adding and removing bees to and from the structure easier, an $(thing)Import$() and $(thing)Export$() feature is provided.$(br2)To import a bee simply capture a bee in a jar, place it in the import slot and click the button.$(br2)To export a bee, fill the jar slot with empty jars, lock and select the bee you wish to

export, and click the button.$(br2)When a bee has been imported, it is $(or)locked$() by default.$(br2)Locking is useful for $(or)preventing comb generation$() of a specific bee type also, as the bee won't be able to exit until it is $(or)unlocked$().

The $(item)Apiary Breeder$() is an automated way to breed bees.$(br2)To use the breeder you must capture each parent bee in a jar and place the filled jars in the appropriate slots.$(br2)You would then need to determine which

flowers each parent needs to trigger its "love" state and place them in the proper slots.$(br2)Lastly, supply empty jars for the child bee to be put into.$(br2)The breeder always runs, but it only consumes resources when it can place a filled jar into the $(l:resourcefulbees:apiary/apiary_storage)$(item)Apiary Storage$().

By default each breed process takes 2 minutes, however this can be reduced through the use of upgrades.$(br2)In addition, only one breed process can occur unless breed upgrades are used in which case the max is five breeds at once.
The breeder is an optional block that that can be added to an Apiary Structure.

When a bee has generated honeycombs in the $(l:resourcefulbees:apiary/apiary_basics)$(item)Apiary$(), they get put into the $(item)Apiary Storage$().$(br2)The Apiary Storage is also used for the outputs from the Apiary Breeder.$(br2)There are $(or)four upgrades$() available to increase the capacity.
You can connect the storage block to item cables or import busses from other mods for automation purposes.
book.resourcefulbees.apiary_category.mul: Building an Apiary Multiblock is extremely $(or)simple$().$(br2)The structure consists of an $(l:resourcefulbees:apiary/apiary_basics)$(item)Apiary$(), an $(l:resourcefulbees:apiary/apiary_storage)$(item)Apiary Storage$(), any block from the $(thing)valid_apiary$() tag, and $(o)optionally$() an $(l:resourcefulbees:apiary/apiary_breeder)$(item)Apiary Breeder$().

The size of the structure should be 7x6x7 so the interior is 5x4x5 as a $(or)hollow box$().$(br2)The $(l:resourcefulbees:apiary/apiary_storage)$(item)Apiary Storage$() and $(l:resourcefulbees:apiary/apiary_breeder)$(item)Apiary Breeder$() (if used) can be placed anywhere as part of the skeletal structure.$(br2)The $(l:resourcefulbees:apiary/apiary_basics)$(item)Apiary$(), however, must be placed $(or)facing inward$() on the face of any one side of the box.

A fantastic way to see this in action would be to enter a creative world and use the $(thing)Creative Build$() button to build a super basic version.$(br2)You can also use the $(thing)Visualize$() button on an $(or)unvalidated$() apiary to see what blocks are invalid and what the structure bounds should look like in world.

The unvalidated Apiary screen also has $(thing)Offset$() buttons to set the position of the Apiary for when it is checking the validity of the structure.$(br)$(o)These buttons are based on the direction the Apiary is facing.$()$(br2)On the next page you can see what a completed structure would look like as well as visualize it in the world.
Visualize the structure to get an idea of how to build it.

While the structure on the left looks ugly in the book, you can make it look beautiful in the world.$(br2)Also, it is recommended that the bottom blocks of the structure be $(or)grass$() blocks or whatever blocks you need to plant "flowers" on.$(br2)It is also recommended to put a light inside to prevent mob spawns.

One final important note regarding the Apiary Multiblock:$(br2)You can use the same skeletal structure to build multiple Apiaries.$(br2)The only caveat in doing so is that $(or)each apiary must have its own storage and breeder block!$()
book.resourcefulbees.bee_category.desc: In this section you will learn basic information about bee keeping.$(br2)Topics covered include: how and where bees $(or)spawn$(), how bees can be $(or)bred$(), what bee $(or)traits$() are and why they are important, and how resourceful bees can $(or)mutate$() blocks into other blocks.
book.resourcefulbees.bee_category.breedi: Some bees may be configured to be breedable. If a bee is breedable, it $(o)may$() have predefined parents, but will $(l)always$() be able to breed with another bee of the same type.

Bee breeding works very much like vanilla breeding, with one notable exception. Some bees may be configured to require multiple $(or)feed items$() in order to trigger the "love" state.$(br2)The $(or)feed item$() for a bee doesn't have to specifically be a flower. It can be configured to use any type of item or tag.
Bees can only be bred in world. Optionally, an $(item)Apiary Breeder$() can be used to breed bees. Visit that section of the book for more information on its usage.
book.resourcefulbees.bee_category.mutati: Some bees are customized with a special pollination effect called $(l)Mutations$(). Mutations allow a bee to convert a block into another block when the bee has $(or)nectar$() and $(or)valid hive$().

A mutation input is the block or block tag being converted. A mutation output is the block the input is being converted to.$(br2)Each bee can have a customizable number of mutations. By this, we mean that the bee can either mutate one block, ten blocks, or a hundred blocks before it would need to enter the hive and reset the counter.
$(o)It is possible to automate the bee mutations using other mods. We will leave that up to you to figure out.$()
book.resourcefulbees.bee_category.spawni: Some bees may have been configured to spawn in the world. The $(or)spawn weight$(), $(or)biome$() and $(or)light level$() can be customized as well as the $(or)min$() and $(or)max$() $(or)group size$().$(br2)Nest generation is also configurable.

When configured to generate, nests will $(l)always$() generate in biomes where bees were configured to spawn.$(br)Weighting for nest generation can be configured independently for Nether, End and Overworld biome categories.$(br)The texture for nests will vary based on the biome.
When nests spawn in the world, they may come prefilled with bees. The number of bees can vary from 0 to 1/2 the $(or)hive max bees$() config value.
book.resourcefulbees.bee_category.traits: Special bees require special $(or)traits$(). A trait given to a bee can provide a variety of effects such as $(or)damage types$() and $(or)immunities$(), $(or)potion effects$() and $(or)immunities$(), $(or)special abilities$(), or $(or)particle effects$(). For more information on traits, see the $(o)$(or)beepedia$()
book.resourcefulbees.centrifuge_category: The chapters here will walk through the various honeycomb processing machines available to your disposal. These machines are key to converting honeycombs into something more useful in your day to day journeys.

To be able to obtain resources from honeycombs, a beekeeper needs to have a centrifuge. Early on, a mechanical centrifuge is sufficient enough to get going. Centrifuging also requires bottles to store liquid honey.
The Mechanical Centrifuge is an entry-level centrifuge. Right-click while sneaking to use.

The Multiblock Centrifuge is a powerhouse compared to the $(item)Powered Centrifuge$(). It has the capability to process Honeycomb Blocks in addition to normal honeycombs. It can also process 3 separate combs simultaneously.
Visualize the structure to get an idea of how to build it.

To build the multiblock you will need $(or)one $(item)Centrifuge Controller$() and $(or)35 $(item)Centrifuge Casings$().$(br2)The structure size is 3x4x3 with the controller one block up from the bottom in the center of any face.
The powered centrifuge will increase efficiency in processing honeycombs at the expense of energy.
This section will walk you through honeycomb generation and collection. We will also discuss several tools available to the most avid beekeepers.

$(or)Honeycombs$() are the most $(or)integral$() byproduct of bees.$(br2)They can be $(or)separated$() in $(items)Centrifuges$() to produce $(or)honey$(), $(or)wax$(), and various other $(or)resources$().$(br2)Every bee capable of producing a honeycomb will

produce it's $(or)own$() type of comb.$(br2)Bear in mind however that $(or)not all$() bees may be able to produce a honeycomb.$(br2)As wonderful as honeycombs can be for producing honey, wax, and resources, they are also a $(or)nutritious$() delicacy capable of providing $(or)sustenance$().

The $(item)Scraper$() is a tool that allows an aspiring beekeeper to collect honeycombs from a beehive. Unlike shears however, the scraper will only collect $(or)one comb$() at a time from a hive. $(l)All$() combs must be collected in order to reset the $(or)Honey Level$().

The $(item)Smoker$() is an absolute must for any bee keepers just getting their feet $(or)sticky$(). Using a Smoker on a hive will have the same effect as placing a $(or)campfire$() beneath the hive. For everyone else, smoking a hive $(or)prevents$() bees from becoming $(#ff0000)angry$() when collecting honeycombs.
To craft a smoker you must first make a Bellow and Smoker Canister which can be combined.$(br2)$(o)Wonder what would happen if I used it on a bee?$()
Tiered beehives are a $(l)massive$() upgrade from the vanilla beehive.$(br2)Tiered Hives are also the only hives which support generation of our custom honeycombs, other than the apiary of course.

For the uninitiated, when a bee collects pollen from a "flower", the bee will fly into a hive and after a period of time will emerge to repeat the process. When the bee is released from the hive a $(or)honeycomb$() will have been generated.$(br2)When the $(or)Honey Level$() reaches 5, the combs can be collected.

Combs can be collected from a Tiered Hive in $(or)two ways$().$(br2)First, when enabled, combs can be collected following the vanilla method using $(item)Shears$().$(br2)The second method is using a $(l:resourcefulbees:honeycomb_gathering/scraper)$(item)Scraper$(), which is $(l)always enabled$().

Both methods can be automated using the $(item)Dispenser$() and some $(#ff0000)redstone$().$(br2)$(l)$(#ff0000)Beware$(), however, that if a Tiered Hive has not been $(l:resourcefulbees:honeycomb_gathering/smoker)$(or)smoked$() prior to collecting the combs, any bees inside will release and become angry.
book.resourcefulbees.help_category.desc: Most bees in this in this mod are customized by the pack developers.$(br2)If you have any bugs, questions, or feedback for us please click the links button to the right.
book.resourcefulbees.help_category.links: Join our $(l:https://discord.gg/rteh4mh)Discord$(/l) for any questions, concerns, feedback, or suggestions.$(br2)Please report any bugs or issue you may have on our $(l:https://github.com/Resourceful-Bees/ResourcefulBees/issues/new/choose)Github$(/l)$(br2)Visit our $(l:https://resourceful-bees.readthedocs.io/en/1.16.3/)wiki$(/l) to learn how to make bees!
An apiary tutorial can be found $(l:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kGdwnjtBRRk)here$(/l)$(br2)
book.resourcefulbees.jei_category.desc: This section covers the JEI categories which are critical to using this mod.
book.resourcefulbees.jei.apiary_category: Outputs of all four apiaries for a single bee.

$(#bd0000)1$() - The bee producing the honeycomb or other output$(br2)$(#bd0000)2$() - The tiered apiary the bee must go in to produce the output$(br2)$(#bd0000)3$() - The output produced by the bee$(br2)Note: Hives display in JEI the same as apiaries
book.resourcefulbees.jei.block_mutation_: Bees can mutate blocks or fluids into other blocks

$(#bd0000)1$() - The bee performing the block mutation$(br2)$(#bd0000)2$() - The block or fluid being mutated when the bee is carrying nectar$(br2)$(#bd0000)3$() - The resulting block from the mutation$(br2)$(#bd0000)4$() - A helpful hint is displayed when mouse is hovering over
Some bees can only be obtained by breeding

$(#bd0000)1$() - The bees getting kinky$(br2)$(#bd0000)2$() - The item and quantity needed to arouse the bee$(br2)$(#bd0000)3$() - The chance these parents will birth this child$(br2)$(#bd0000)4$() - The result of the bees not using a contraceptive
book.resourcefulbees.jei.centrifuge_cate: The centrifuge is used to get resources from honeycombs

$(#bd0000)1$() - The bottle input is optional$(br2)$(#bd0000)2$() - The main input and amount needed$(br2)$(#bd0000)3$() - The main output produced. This can also be a fluid$(br2)$(#bd0000)4$() - The secondary output produced$(br2)$(#bd0000)5$() - If a bottle is supplied, this is the output produced
$(#bd0000)6$() - Some recipes are multiblock recipes only$(br2)$(#bd0000)7$() - The chance of getting the associated output
book.resourcefulbees.jei.flower_category: Bees need to pollinate the proper flower to produce a honeycomb
$(#bd0000)1$() - The bee doing the pollination$(br2)$(#bd0000)2$() - The flower the bee needs to pollinate
book.resourcefulbees.jei.fluid_mutation_: Bees can mutate blocks into fluids or fluids into other fluids

$(#bd0000)1$() - The bee performing the fluid mutation$(br2)$(#bd0000)2$() - The block or fluid being mutated when the bee is carrying nectar$(br2)$(#bd0000)3$() - The resulting fluid from the mutation$(br2)$(#bd0000)4$() - A helpful hint is displayed when mouse is hovering over
book.resourcefulbees.ender_beecon_catego: Ender Beecon
Consumes honey to protect your bees.
Beecon Basics
Ender Disruption
Filling the Beecon
Effects
Beecon Options

The Ender Beecon is designed with giving all your bees freedom to mingle in mind.$(br2)It does this by effecting your bees in various ways. One major one is that it will prevent bees from despawning within it's effect range.$(br2)Other ways bees are effected can be found in later chapters.
Disruption Range

If you have issues with bees teleporting away then the Ender Beecon is for you.$(br2)To prevent your bees from teleporting you simply need to supply your Ender Beecon with honey.$(br2)So long as the internal tank has honey in it it will prevent bees from teleporting.
The range that the Ender Beecon will prevent bees from teleporting can be found in the interface.$(br2)This range will increase with each effect that is active.
Tank Stacking
The Ender Beecon requires honey to function as such you

will need to be able to fill it with honey.$(br2)This can be done in many ways, with either a honey bucket or honey bottle you can insert the item into the interface and the tank will automatically fill itself from the contents.$(br2)You can also simply right click the tank with bottle or buckets to fill it that way.

If you need more honey input, you can simply put any tank with honey in it underneath the Ender Beecon.$(br2)It will automatically refill itself from the tank, You can also simply pipe honey in from any side of the device.
When you upgrade your tank from one tier to another it will retain any honey left in it.

The Calming effect when applied to bees will prevent them from getting angry, It will also calm bees down who are already angry.$(br2)If a bee has the Angry trait it will calm them down, allowing you to keep them around other bees.
Water Breathing when applied to bees will prevent them from drowning when coming in contact with water.$(br2)Now your bees can take a nice little drink without dying.
Fire Resistance does what it says on the tin, it will prevent all forms of fire damage from hurting your bees.$(br2)Now you can keep your nether bees around without worry.
Regeneration is for any other damage that bees can take, warning though it tends to be quite honey consuming to keep this active.

The Ender Beecon can apply certain effects to your bees. While effects are active they will drain honey from the internal tank.$(br2)The more effects that are active the larger the effect range will be and the more honey the Beecon will consume.
Beam Color
Toggling the Beam
Muting the Beecon

The Ender Beecon's beam will change color based on the type of honey that is inside the internal tank.$(br2)Default honey and Catnip honey will leave the Beecon beam white if you don't want to stand out.$(br2)Rainbow colored honey will make the beam rainbow too.
If you want to hide the Ender Beecon's beam all you need to do is right click the Beecon with a stick.$(br2)Now you can hide your Beecons without them bee-ing seen.
If you can't stand the noise the Ender Beecon makes you can suppress it by simply right clicking it with some wool.$(br2)If you want to hear your Beecon again simply right click it again.
There are some tools that a beekeeper just can't do without.

Right-click a bee to select it. Right-click an appropriate flower to set its flower position or right-click a hive to set its hive position.$(br2)Shift + right-click to clear selected bee. Setting a bees position will also clear the selected bee.
More uses for the Honey Dipper are planned :)
The Bee Jar is used for capturing and transporting bees. When releasing a bee from the jar, the flower and hive positions will be cleared while the rest of a bees memories and data are retained.
The bee box works like the jar except that it can carry up to 10 bees at once.
A lost bee box can be obtained when upgrading hives containing bees.
The beepedia is the ultimate device for learning about the bees in your world. It provides all the same information as JEI, plus more! Seriously, check it out!
The beepedia can also keep track of which bees you've interacted with by right-clicking a bee while holding it.
book.resourcefulbees.getting_started.des: This section go into how to get started with this mod, with things like how to find and capture bees, how to safely store them and how to keep track of what bees you've encountered.
book.resourcefulbees.getting_started.fin: Bees can be found within nests, they can also be found roaming the world, spawning in like other mobs.$(br2)If you want to find out where bees can spawn you can find out via the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beepedia)Beepedia$() or by looking up the bee in JEI.
Some bees do not spawn naturally and will instead need to be bred. You can find more information about breeding bees $(thing)$(l:getting_started/breeding_bees)here$().
book.resourcefulbees.getting_started.col: Once you've found some bees you're going to want to collect them and take them home with you.$(br2)There are several ways to do this, your best bet is to use a $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/bee_jar)Bee Jar$() or a $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/bee_box)Bee Box$().$(br2)You can also do it the more traditional way with a lead or the bee's breeding item.
book.resourcefulbees.getting_started.und: Once you have some bees you will likely want to know what they can do and what to do with them.$(br2)If you craft yourself a $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beepedia)Beepedia$() you can learn a lot more about what each bee can do. If you press $(thing)$(k:key.use)$() on a bee you can open the bee's page in the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beepedia)Beepedia$().

You can also use JEI to search up information about bees.$(br2)Keep in mind that bees have both $(thing)$(k:key.use)$() and $(thing)$(k:key.attack)$() uses. You may also find information on how to breed or obtain bees by looking at the bee's spawn eggs or at the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/bee_jar)Bee Jar's$() uses.
book.resourcefulbees.getting_started.kee: Bees are nice little things but they have minds of their own, so you're going to want to make a place for them.$(br2)First you're going to want to gather yourself some $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beehives)Bee Hives$() and then you are going to want to make an enclosed area so they can't fly away.$(br2)

Some bees have special flowers, bees cannot and will not pollinate or create honeycombs unless they have the right flowers.$(br2)Make sure to check what each bee needs for it's flower with the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beepedia)Beepedia$() or JEI.
book.resourcefulbees.getting_started.col: An example of an automatic hive harvester.

Automating the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beehives)Hives/$ can easily be done by using a $(item)Hopper/$ or any kind of redstone clock, together with a $(item)Dispenser/$ using a $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/scraper)Scraper/$.$(p)This will harvest all the combs without needing you to smoke the hive.
book.resourcefulbees.getting_started.pro: An image of the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/mechanical_centrifuge)Manual Centrifuge/$ processing honeycombs.

To start off with, you will have to craft a $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/mechanical_centrifuge)Manual Centrifuge/$. You can then place your honeycombs and empty bottles in it to be processed.$(p)Note that only the multiblock centrifuges will take honeycomb blocks.$(p)You will need some $(item)Wax$() in order to craft the higher tier centrifuges.
book.resourcefulbees.advanced_tips.desc: This section will go into advanced sections of the mod that you may encounter once you have gotten your bees set up.
book.resourcefulbees.advanced_tips.apiar: The $(item)Apiary/$ is the next upgrade for the $(thing)$(l:getting_started/keeping_bees)Beehives/$. $(p)It can house more bees, produce more honeycombs and make $(thing)$(l:getting_started/breeding_bees)breeding/$ easier.

The $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/apiary_storage)Apiary Storage/$ and $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/apiary_breeder)Apiary Breeder/$ can be placed anywhere in the multiblock's walls. $(p)The $(item)Apiary/$ size is 7x7x5. Once you place down the $(item)Apiary/$, you can click the preview button to see a highlight of where you have to place blocks. You can also use the arrow buttons to move the multiblock around the $(item)Apiary/$ block.

When honeycombs are produced by the bees, they will show up in the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/apiary_storage)Apiary Storage/$, which can then be removed manually, or automated via $(item)Hoppers/$ or pipes from other mods.$(p)The $(item)Apiary/$ comes with some restrictions: it can only house 9 unique bees, which means you can have as many bees as you want in the enclosure, but there cannot be

more than one of the same type of bee in the $(item)Apiary/$ for them to enter.$(p)To give an example of the 'unique' limitation: you can have two or more $(item)Redstone/$ and $(item)Coal Bees/$ in the enclosure, but only one $(item)Redstone/$ and $(item)Coal Bee/$ inside the $(item)Apiary/$. Once a $(item)Redstone Bee/$ has left the $(item)Apiary/$, the other $(item)Redstone Bee/$ may now enter.
book.resourcefulbees.apiary_category.mul: The multiblock must have an $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/apiary_storage)Apiary Storage/$ and optionally an $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/apiary_breeder)Apiary Breeder/$.
book.resourcefulbees.advanced_tips.calmi: The Calming effect when applied to bees will prevent them from getting angry, it will also calm bees down if they are already angry.

If a bee has the Angry trait it will calm them down, allowing you to keep them around other bees.$(br2)Bees can be granted the Calming effect in two ways, one is via a $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/calming_potions)Splash Potion of Calming$() or by using an $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/ender_beecon)Ender Beecon$().
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.de: This section will go in depth about all of the items and blocks you can use to enhance your beekeeping journey.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.be: Bee jars are able to hold a single bee, simply $(thing)Right Click$() on a bee to collect it.$(br2)Releasing bees is done via another $(thing)Right Click$().
Bee jars can also be renamed in an $(item)Anvil$() to which will rename the bee inside.

Bee boxes are able to hold up to 10 bees at a time, simply $(thing)Right Click$() on a bee to collect it. They can also collect bees from $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beehives)Bee Hives, Nests, or Apiaries$(), simply $(thing)Sneak Right Click$() on a nest to collect all bees inside. $(br2)$(#900)Don't forget to smoke the hive first!$()
To release bees simply $(thing)Right Click$() to release a single bee, to release all bees at once use $(thing)Sneak Right Click$().
Bees need places to live, these nests and hives can be upgraded to store even more bees and combs.
Bee Nests can be found around the world, you can pick them up without $(thing)Silk Touch$() but if you use $(thing)Silk Touch$() you will collect any bees inside.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.sc: The $(item)Scraper/$ is an unbreakable tool that can be used to harvest $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beehives)Bee Hives$().$(br2)The scraper can also be used in a $(item)Dispenser$() the same way $(item)Shears$() can.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.sm: The $(item)Smoker/$ is a simple tool, if you use it on a $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/beehives)Bee Hive$() it will smoke it, preventing bees from angering if you attempt to harvest or collect the bees with a $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools:bee_box)Bee Box$().
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.be: The $(item)Beepedia/$ is an amazing tool that allows you to find out anything you should need to know about bees.$(br2)If you $(thing)Right Click$() on a bee with this item you will open that bee's page and record it's data for later.
The information stored within the beepedia is saved per player and will be kept even if you lose the item.
The Beepedia allows you to search for bees combs or honey via the search box.$(br2)You can also use special search terms to filter bees by certain criteria.

$(#F80)#discovered$()$(br)- Bees that you have discovered.$(br2)$(#F80)#unknown$()$(br)-  Bees that you have yet to discover.$(br2)$(#F80)#mutates$()$(br)- Bees that have mutations.$(br2)$(#F80)#breedable$()$(br)- Bees that can be bred.

$(#F80)#spawns$()$(br)- Bees that spawn in the world.$(br2)$(#F80)#aura$()$(br)- Bees that have a $(thing)$(l:advanced_tips/auras)Special Aura$().$(br2)$(#F80)#easter$()$(br)- Easter Egg bees added by devs or Patrens.$(br2)$(#F80)#special$()$(br)- Bees that likely have special methods to obtain.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.ho: The $(item)Honey Dipper/$ is a special tool that allows you to direct bees.$(br2)You can set where a bee's hive or flower position is, allowing for you to split up bees if they all crowd around a single flower.
To change a bee's settings simply $(thing)Right Click$() on a bee and then $(thing)Right Click$() on a hive or flower.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.ca: Calming Potions are potions that give things the calming effect, however the $(thing)$(l:advanced_tips/calming)Calming Effect$() has no effects on players but it does on neutral mobs, so splash or lingering Calming potions are your best friend.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.ho: The $(item)Honey Tanks/$ can hold a certain amount of liquid honey.$(p)There are three tiers, each with their own capacity:$(li1)Wooden: 8,000mb$(li1)Nether: 32,000mb$(li1)Purpur: 128,000mb
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.bo: The $(item)Bottomless Honey Pot/$ is a tank that will delete any liquid honey put in it.$(p)It is meant for automation with pipes, where you can delete excess honey.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.ho: The $(item)Honey Congealer/$ is a simple block that requires no power. It will turn liquid honey into their respective honey blocks.$(p)Best to use with pipes from other mods.

The $(item)Honey Glass/$ is a special type of glass that let either players or bees to go through it.$(p)It is suitable for apiaries so players can go in and out of the multiblock without breaking the walls.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.ap: The $(item)Apiary/$ block is the main part of the apiary multiblock. You must also use an $(thing)$(l:beekeeping_tools/apiary_storage)Apiary Storage$() for the multiblock.$(p)For more info on the multiblock and how it works, click $(thing)$(l:advanced_tips/apiaries)here$().

The $(item)Apiary Breeder/$ will make breeding easier by allowing you to place the two bees, together with their food and a jar, inside it and not have the hassle of running around after them.$(p)If the breeding is successful, the new bee will be placed in the $(item)Apiary Storage/$.

You can also upgrade the $(item)Apiary Breeder/$ with $(item)Breeder Upgrade/$ and $(item)Breed Time Upgrade/$.$(p)They add more slots and also reduce the time needed for the breed.$(p)You can have up to four upgrades at any time.

The $(item)Apiary Storage/$ is the block where all the $(item)Apiary/$ resources will go to.$(p)You can manually take out the items, or automate it with a $(item)Hopper/$.$(p)Each $(item)Apiary/$ must have one $(item)Apiary Storage/$.
You can use $(item)Storage Upgrades/$ to increase the number of slots.$(p)You can only have one upgrade and a choice of four tiers.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.ho: The $(item)Honey Generator/$ will turn liquid honey into RF. This can be used to power the centrifuges.$(p)Honey is inserted with either $(thing)Honey Bottles$() or directly pumped with pipes.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.me: The $(item)Manual Centrifuge/$ is the most basic type of centrifuge.$(br)It requires no power, but you will have to actively turn it by holding down $(thing)Shift$() + $(thing)Right Click$().$(p)It is limited to only processing honeycombs, not blocks.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.ce: The $(item)Centrifuge/$ will use RF to turn your combs into resources.$(p)There is a limitation that it can only process honeycombs, not blocks.$(p)This process can be automated with $(item)Hoppers/$.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.mu: The $(item)Multiblock Centrifuge/$ is an upgraded version of the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/centrifuge)Centrifuge/$ that will increase the amount of resources from the processing of combs and allow processing of comb blocks as well.$(p)This process can be automated with $(item)Hoppers/$.
book.resourcefulbees.beekeeping_tools.el: The $(item)Elite Centrifuge/$ is an upgraded version of the $(item)$(l:beekeeping_tools/multiblock_centrifuge)Multiblock Centrifuge/$.$(p)This process can be automated with $(item)Hoppers/$.
book.resourcefulbees.ender_beecon.desc: Consumes honey to protect your bees.
book.resourcefulbees.ender_beecon.basics: The Ender Beecon is designed with giving all your bees freedom to mingle in mind.$(br2)It does this by effecting your bees in various ways. One major one is that it will prevent bees from despawning within it's effect range.$(br2)Other ways bees are effected can be found in later chapters.
book.resourcefulbees.ender_beecon.telepo: If you have issues with bees teleporting away then the Ender Beecon is for you.$(br2)To prevent your bees from teleporting you simply need to supply your Ender Beecon with honey.$(br2)So long as the internal tank has honey in it it will prevent bees from teleporting.
The Ender Beecon requires honey to function as such you
When you upgrade your tank from one tier to another it will retain any honey left in it.
book.resourcefulbees.ender_beecon.effect: Water Breathing when applied to bees will prevent them from drowning when coming in contact with water.$(br2)Now your bees can take a nice little drink without dying.
Fire Resistance does what it says on the tin, it will prevent all forms of fire damage from hurting your bees.$(br2)Now you can keep your nether bees around without worry.
Regeneration is for any other damage that bees can take, warning though it tends to be quite honey consuming to keep this active.

The Ender Beecon can apply certain effects to your bees. While effects are active they will drain honey from the internal tank.$(br2)The more effects that are active the larger the effect range will be and the more honey the Beecon will consume.
book.resourcefulbees.ender_beecon.option: The Ender Beecon's beam will change color based on the type of honey that is inside the internal tank.$(br2)Default, Catnip, and Starry honey will leave the Beecon beam white if you don't want to stand out.$(br2)Rainbow colored honey will make the beam rainbow too.
book.resourcefulbees.extras.waxed_planks: Have excess wax? Why not make some waxed planks?
book.resourcefulbees.extras.desc: This section is for extra stuff you can do with this mod.$(br2)Helpful Links:$(li)$(6)$(l:https://discord.com/invite/resourcefulbees)Discord$()$(li)$(6)$(l:https://patreon.resourcefulbees.com)Patreon$()$(li)$(6)$(l:https://github.com/Resourceful-Bees/ResourcefulBees)Github$()$(li)$(6)$(l:https://wiki.resourcefulbees.com)Wiki$()
book.resourcefulbees.extras.dev_bees.1: Rare bees that can be found throughout the world.
book.resourcefulbees.extras.dev_bees.abb: This bee was created by absent- via Patreon.
book.resourcefulbees.extras.patreon.base: This bee can be any color you want.
